sentences.en: Dart, who had at first been very tense, at last relaxed.
sentences.cn: 起初，达特非常紧张，最后终于放松了下来。

sentences.en: Every nerve in her body was tense.
sentences.cn: 她的每一根神经都绷得紧紧的。

sentences.en: His voice had lost its resonance; it was tense and strained.
sentences.cn: 他的声音不再洪亮，而是显得紧张，不太自然。

sentences.en: I tried not to tense up, or become obviously wary.
sentences.cn: 我尽量不让自己紧张，或者表现得非常警觉。

sentences.en: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.cn: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

sentences.en: It was a day of tense and often ill-tempered debate.
sentences.cn: 那天的辩论紧张激烈，常常火药味十足。

sentences.en: It was as though Corinne was already dead: they were speaking of her in the past tense.
sentences.cn: 就好像科琳已经死了似的：他们当时在用过去时态谈起她。

sentences.en: My arms are tired, and my back is tense.
sentences.cn: 我的胳膊很累，背部肌肉紧绷得难受。
纽曼的腹部肌肉绷紧了。

sentences.en: She coveted his job so openly that conversations between them were tense.
sentences.cn: 她毫不隐讳地表示想得到他的工作，以至于他们之间说话都带着火药味。

sentences.en: She lay, eyes shut, body tense.
sentences.cn: 她躺着，双目紧闭，全身绷直。

sentences.en: She seemed nervous or tense, and she was definitely short with me.
sentences.cn: 她似乎很焦虑，抑或是很紧张，对我明显很不客气。

sentences.en: Tense up the muscles in both of your legs.
The gentlest of her caresses would contort his already tense body.
sentences.cn: 她最温柔的爱抚会让他已然紧绷的身体变得扭曲。
有一阵令人局促不安的沉默。

sentences.en: They seem less tense, more even-tempered.
sentences.cn: 他们看起来不那么紧张，更加平和了。

sentences.en: Tina was tense, her hand poised over the telephone.
sentences.cn: 蒂娜心情紧张，手悬在电话机上。

sentences.en: When we are under stress our bodies tend to tense up.
sentences.cn: 人一紧张，身体就会变僵硬。

words.tran_cn: 张力，拉力；紧张，不安；电压
拉紧；变为紧张（tense的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 拉紧的，肌肉绷紧的，神经紧张的，[语]（语音）紧的
trans.tran_en: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.
If your muscles tense, if you tense, or if you tense your muscles, your muscles become tight and stiff, often because you are anxious or frightened
